Name: Piece of funerary sheet
Description: This linen cloth with loops of ecru-coloured linen and polychrome wool comes from the tomb of Aurelius Colluthus in Antinoopolis, discovered by A. Gayet during excavations in 1899-1900. It consists of six large registers, each separated by a long vertical strip in red and decorated with rosettes, crosses and flowers with four petals.
